function.intro: Times of war are dire and cruel, you need to step up in line and take command of the forces as the previous commander was abruptly stripped of his ranks. His incapabilities were disappointing, you’re expected to do better...
Sir, we are expecting your orders

function.question: You see the enemy advancing towards your lands. A crucial time to make a decision, do you..

choice.content: Provoke the enemy by mobilizing your troops and advance towards the enemy.
Mobilize your troops in a defensive line.
Remain passive, do not provoke the enemy.

function.question: Nearby the enemy sets up camp near your borders, your soldiers grow worried to the consequences of this hostile tactical positioning, or what lies behind this camp. It seems to be growing daily, immediate action is required.

choice.content: Mobilize your troops immediately and approach the camp.
They are not in your territory, leave them be.
Send someone to find out what they are doing.

function.question: A huge shadow covers the battlefield, your eyes widen at the sight of this colossal winged beast in the skies, scorching the ground with hellish fire.

choice.content: Spread out and flee, make sure the collateral damage is limited.
Show no fear, challenge the beast!
Hide from the dragon.

function.title: Betrayal Ending: You remained way too passive throughout your reign, this is unacceptable and caused your soldiers to organize a coup, publicly executing you in front of your throne to make an example out of your incompetence. Keep in mind that you should not be to passive in war

function.question: A huge man in a suit approaches you. He questions your leadership on the base of the previous one being the weakling that he was.

choice.content: Attack him to prove yourself!
Convince him using words!
Run like the pussy you are!

function.title: Incompetence ending: Your consecutive failures have brought this upon you. Your incapabilities make room for the next commander to rise and fall. Allowing change, in need of a more competent commander.

function.question: One of your scouts is all fired up ready for his orders! What direction will you send him to?

choice.content: Send him to scout behind enemy lines.
Send him to find supply routes of your enemies.
Tell him he is not needed right now.

function.intro: Spreading out reduced the casualties to a minimum, you got away safely.
It was foolish to challenge the dragon, you lost most of your men. You lose a life.
You remain passive and quiet, the dragon left the parameters.
You mobilize your troops and move out to give them hell! You gain a boost in attack and strike them head on.
You prepare your defenses but do not provoke the enemy. You gain defense.
You let the enemy advance, hoping they’ll pass. You remain neutral.

function.title: Agrassive Ending: Your infamy rose to a critical level which has struck fear throughout the entire kingdom, the brutality of your reign has lost your soldiers faith. Out of fright they sent assassins after you. If you keep attacking and destroy cities, people will get scared of you.

function.question: As you advance you come across a small caravan with supplies, the merchant offers you food.

choice.content: Take the food.
Do not take the deal.
Kill the merchant

function.intro: A great feast boosts the morale of your soldiers, however shortly after the meat left the bone and the ale dried up in their bellies the soldiers started to violently puke blood. You lose a life.
You kindly refuse the food and let the merchant walk away. You remain neutral.
As the merchant approaches, you attack him with a swift stroke to the neck. As his head rolls on the floor you approach the caravan and burn the food. You infamy rises.
The scout was caught by the enemy, his head was sent back to you. You lose a life.

function.question: Your scout comes back with good news from the front, giving you the supply routes of your enemy. What will you do?

choice.content: Set up camp and ambush all supply runs.
Steal the supplies.
Leave the routes alone for now.

function.intro: Your scout walks away disappointed.
You brutally ambush every supply caravan in your sight, sending back a caravan of corpses instead. Your infamy rises.
You steal the supplies to share with your fellow man. You gain health.
You refuse to take hostile action against innocent merchants. You remain passive.
The Senator admires your courage and lets you leave with your forces intact.
The Senator remarks on how futile it is to convince one with words of his own prowess in combat.
The Senator mocks you as you run away saying you are even too spineless to defend yourself.

function.question: You come across a small cylinder tree with small needles on all sides. There are also a few small branches that appear to be upside down with a various red, spiked fruits on it. Legend says that with these fruits one can perform "Equivalent Exchange". The user has to sacrifice something to gain something else.

choice.content: Eat the fruit and wish for power.
Eat the fruit with desire for money.
Ignore the fruit and keep walking.

function.question: One of your eyes turns to stone and you feel newfound strength coursing through you.
You lose a leg and gain some gold.

function.intro: You walked away from the opportunity and nothing has changed.

function.question: A man walks around and a couple coins fall out of his pants. What will you do?

choice.content: Pick it up and get out of there.
Leave it.

function.intro: You walk away happy as fuck
Hello You walked away leaving the man without his coins.

function.question: You spend the money to buy a new sword. The shopkeeper tells you you were the friendliest customer he has seen all day and he gives you the sword with $200 extra!

choice.content: Take the free money and the sword.
Don’t take the money and only take the sword.

function.question: The owner of an entire city has come to you to tell you that he sold his city to the king and he admires you so much that he gives all of the money to you!

choice.content: Refuse the money and walk away.
Take the money and walk away.

function.question: You now have more money then you know what to do with and your army cant even move that amount by themselves. You have to make a choice.

choice.content: Leave it behind.
Take whatever you can

function.intro: You walk away with the sword and $500!
The owner gets mad and gives you even more money! You now have the sword and $1100 in total!
The owner gives you all of the money anyway and runs away.
You walk away with all your money.
You walk away without any money.
You walk away with a huge part of the money.

function.title: Curse Ending: When you open the door of your room it turns out to be filled to the brim with coins and it flows out of the door and buries you. you should not take cursed money

function.intro: Briefing: Remember, as a leading example people watch your every move and judge you for actions too hostile or actions too passive. Try to find your balance within the chaotic battlefields and do not get carried away, your actions must be just and righteous or you will face the consequences. Leading to dreadful fatalities.
You decide to be aggressive. You advance your troops towards the enemy lines, immediately they open fire at you. From a clear disadvantage you taketoo many casualties and are forced to retreat.
You decide to be passive. They don’t seem to do any harm yet.
You send one of your soldiers to check what they are doing. After waiting a little while the horse of your soldier returns without the soldier. What happened to your soldier?

function.question: Do you accept that the enemy treats you with such disrespect? Remember, the council watches over your

choice.content: Mobilize your troops immediately and approach the camp.
They are not in your territory, leave them be.
Ignore the threats of your enemy

function.question: A scout reports to you that he’s found an abandoned chapel behind a range of hills.The chapel has not been documented on any known map or text.

choice.content: Tell the scout to further investigate the chapel.
Travel to the chapel to investigate it personally.
Tell the scout to ignore the chapel and to do his work properly.

function.intro: The scout travels back to the chapel and found something worth more than his yearly earnings and deserted your army.
As you enter the withered chapel you hear the floorboards creak under the weight of every step you take.
As you berate the scout on his useless findings and order him to return to his job. With some mild irritation the scout takes his leave.

function.question: Through the dust floating through the small room, you are able to discern an altar, 3 broken benches and a door missing its lock and doorknob.

choice.content: Walk towards the altar and investigate it.
You decide to scour the area with the broken benches.
Check what’s behind the door.

function.intro: As you get closer to the altar you see a faint glistening at its base. As you kneel to uncover this reflective object you see that it’s a golden plated mirror. You reckon that this mirror will bring you a nice sum of gold.
You try to open a path between the benches and as you attempt to lift the second bench. The bench breaks and you fall to the ground. You hit your head on a small brass ring.
You carefully open the door but as the door opens you feel a heavy force hitting your head and fall unconscious. Your wake up back in you camp.

function.question: While rubbing the wound on your head. You stare at the spot you hit your head. After looking closer at the ring you realise that it’s actually the handle of a trap door.

choice.content: Try to open the trapdoor. By pulling up the brass ring.
Ignore the trapdoor and continue checking the other benches.
Open the trapdoor by twisting the brass ring.

function.intro: You pull as hard as you can. Trying your best to open the trapdoor. The trapdoor stays shut and the brass ring breaks off. Falling once again to the floor you hit your head against the wall.

You have no interest in whatever could be in a trapdoor of an abandoned chapel and proceed with your initial plans. You find nothing of interest between the benches, but you did find a silver cup adorned with rubies. Contend with this expensive trinket you exit the chapel and head back to the camp, so you can treat your wound.

As you twist and turn the brass ring you hear a soft click. The trapdoor flips open and hits you in the face. Bewildered and confused you hear a raspy voice calling you. The voice originates from the opening of the trapdoor and you move your head above the hole to see a broken piece of metal that resembles a spearhead.

function.question: “I am the spear of Shortinius” says the spearhead. “O valorous soul. Mount me on a staff and I shall bestow tremendous powers upon you!” You ponder what you should do?

choice.content: You conclude that you must’ve fallen harder than you thought and that it would be wise to return home.
You give into your delusions and pick-up the spearhead and head back to the camp to fit it on a polearm.
Convinced that the little piece of metal must be bewitched. You run outside of the chapel and tell your man to torch down the place.

function.intro: Ignoring the pleas and promises of the spearhead, you exit the chapel and head back to your encampment. Once arrived you immediately thrust yourself upon your bed and hope you headache has ended once you have had your 11 hours of sleep.

The moment you secure the rusty spearhead on a polearm, the spearheads start to emit an intensely bright light. You are blinded by this sudden burst of brightness and it take a several minute before your sight returns to you. You now see that the spearhead is if newly forged, no longer rusty or broken even. “Thank you, for giving me a new body to use.” The voice no longer raspy but strong and smooth. The spear continues ”As promised, I shall now serve you as my new master!”
As you tell the men of your otherworldly encounter with the raspy voice. The frightful men follow your orders to burn down the chapel and head back to the camp.
Sir, The council sen you a messega that if you dont start to be more aggrasive in your choices they will make you step down your possision
